article.title: Adding Source Files to Your Project

introduction.paragraph: If you need to debug Couchbase Lite, you can include the Couchbase Lite code in your project rather than using a JAR file or the Maven artifact dependencies. If you choose to add the source files, make sure you remove any Maven or JAR file dependencies that you used previously.
Follow these steps to add Couchbase Lite source files directly to your project:

list-item.paragraph: Change to the parent MyProject directory, which contains the settings.gradle file.
Add any optional submodules that you need:
list-item.code-block: $ git submodule add https://github.com/couchbase/couchbase-lite-android-listener.git CBLiteListener $ git submodule add https://github.com/couchbase/couchbase-lite-android-javascript.git CBLiteJavascript

If you included any optional submodules, add compile statements for them to the MyProject/MyProject/build.gradle file.
